comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Emmybit001 on May 12, 2024, 10:07:47 AMA question to all of you that have invested in Bitcoin before, what does it look like? Because I know there are so many people that want to get into it, but they fill is not real, so I want to get some ideas from anybody that know how it's work please üôè.You can invest in Bitcoin in mainly two ways which are as a long-time holder or trader. Those who keep Bitcoin for a long period until the price goes up are usually long-term investors. While traders buy and sell based on daily, weekly, or monthly predictions. Investing in Bitcoin is just the same thing as putting money into other businesses. The only difference is that you need to understand the Bitcoin ecosystem before investing. If you are a long-term investor, you just need to seek a means of acquiring Bitcoin, maybe from an exchange or P2P and keep the money safe on a decentralized open-source wallet. A hardware wallet will be a better option if you can afford it. The next phase is to learn how to keep your investment safe. You would have to keep the coin for a long time until the price gets to the level you want it before you sell and collect your profit.
